instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message: I have this macbook with no backlight and not charging. I have taken the board out plugged the charger in and it blows the p7 transistor on the dc in board, when the board is in the machine it dosnt show a light when plugged in and it dosnt blow the p7 , only when the board is out of the machine . works on battery with no backlight i can see the circle with a line through it on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message:
DCIN board doesn't have any transistor.
That is a TVS diode, like BAT30CW, or RCLAM2402.
If get it blown, means an overvoltage occured.
It can be caused by fake charger.
Original charger generates aprox (only) 3V when is connected; for Magsafe 2 case.
Its processor allows full voltage if no problem detected in the machine.
Fake charger has no processor inside and always gives out full voltage.
That's the reason of many power problems in MacBooks...
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger 60/85W.
Do NOT use Magsafe 1 to 2 adapter, as you can have backlight issue on this model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message: Thank you , must be fake charger will try new charger and need new p7 diode or new dc in board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message: Back again :) so i got the new dc board and genuine charger all is good there. the mac fires up and i can see a faint pic so backlight problem there ' the main issue is the charger light is flickering and not powering the machine or charging the battery.i have checked <SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_CONN</SIGNAL> power rail i get 16.8v . can you guide me on where to go next please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message:
Resistance to ground (diode mode) at <DIODE>D7710</DIODE>, both pins.
Also post some voltages for <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, pins 5, 18, 17, 11.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message:
<DIODE>D7710</DIODE> pin 1 0.879 and pin 2 1.189. 
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> pin 5 0v pin 18 0v pin 17 0v pin 11 0.183v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> pin 5 0v pin 18 0v"
Check resistance to ground now.
If =<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_BKLT</SIGNAL> is present, then check <RESISTOR>R7144</RESISTOR>/45.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message:
pin 18 16.4 kilo ohm .pin 5 16.66 kilo ohm.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_BKLT</SIGNAL> is not present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message: Checked <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> no voltage on any pin and <RESISTOR>R5530</RESISTOR> looks like 4 pads with no voltage either. As you can tell i am quite lost .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc board and backlight issue.
threads.message:
Check pin 1 trace.
It should have 5V, as it comes from L7520.
